name: Student visa
description: For courses lasting 6 months or longer at a UKVI-approved institution.

eligibility.academic: Acceptance onto a course at the appropriate level.
eligibility.financial: Demonstrate you have enough money to support yourself (currently £1,334 per month for courses outside London, £1,806 for courses in London, for up to 9 months).
eligibility.english_language: Meet the English language requirements specified by your institution (e.g., IELTS).

steps: Apply online via the UK Visas and Immigration website.
Pay the Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS) (currently £470 per year).
Attend an appointment at a visa application centre (VAC) to submit your biometrics and supporting documents.

nepal_specific_requirements.ward_verification: May be required for some applicants
nepal_specific_requirements.interview: You may be called for an interview at the VAC.

practical_tips: Start your application early, at least 3 months before your course start date.
Ensure all your documents are complete and accurate.
Prepare for the interview by reviewing your application and being ready to answer questions about your course and finances.

title: UK Student Visa Overview for Nepali Students
content: The UK Student visa (formerly Tier 4) allows those 16 and over to study in the UK. Those 16 or 17 attending independent schools may need a Child Student visa. [1]

citations.quote:
You can apply for a Student visa to study in the UK if you’re 16 or over and you:
If you’re 16 or 17 and you want to study at an independent school in the UK, you may be eligible for a Child Student visa instead.
This visa has replaced the Tier 4 (General) student visa.

title: UK Student Visa Document Requirements for Nepali Applicants
content: Required: passport, Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS). [2]  Potentially required: financial proof, ATAS certificate (if applicable), parental consent (if under 18), relationship proof (if under 18), tuberculosis test results, sponsor consent (if applicable). [2] Those under 18 need written consent from parents/guardians for the application, UK living arrangements, and travel, plus a birth certificate/government-issued document showing parents' names. [2]

citations.quote:
When you apply for your Student visa you must provide:
- a current passport or other valid travel documentation
- a Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) from your course provider

You may also need to provide:
- proof you have enough money to support yourself and pay for your course - this will vary depending on your circumstances
- a valid ATAS certificate if your course and nationality require it
- proof of parental or other legal guardian consent if you’re under 18
- proof of your relationship to your parent or guardian if you’re under 18
- your tuberculosis test results
- written consent for your application from your financial sponsor if you’ve received sponsorship for your course fees and living costs in the last 12 months

If you’re under 18 you’ll need written consent from both parents or legal guardians (or one parent if they have sole responsibility).
This must include their consent for:
- your visa application
- your living and care arrangements in the UK
- your travel to the UK
You’ll also need to provide a copy of your birth certificate (or another government issued document) that shows the names of your parents.

title: UK Student Visa Application Process from Nepal
content: Apply up to 6 months before your course starts from outside the UK, or up to 3 months if already in the UK (ensure the new course begins within 28 days of your current visa expiring). [1] Decisions usually take 3 weeks (outside UK) or 8 weeks (inside UK). [1]  Faster decisions may be available for a fee. [1]

citations.quote: The earliest you can apply for a visa is 6 months before you start your course.

The earliest you can apply is 3 months before your course starts.
You must apply before your current visa expires. Your new course must begin within 28 days of your current visa expiring.

You’ll usually get a decision on your visa within:
- 3 weeks, if you’re outside the UK
- 8 weeks, if you’re inside the UK
You may be able to pay to get a faster decision - you’ll be told if you can when you apply.

title: British Embassy Kathmandu
content: The British Embassy in Kathmandu represents the UK government in Nepal. [3] They provide services to British nationals and handle UK-Nepal relations. [3]  For travel advice specific to Nepal, consult their resources. [3]

citations.quote: Our work covers a range of issues including representing the British government in its relations with the Nepalese government and the people of Nepal.
We provide services to British nationals living in and visiting Nepal.
If you’re travelling in Nepal, see our Nepal travel advice.
